attributes.text:
Combination effect “Drop Out”

Moves the element to the given direction while fading it out.
The DOM element

Returns the (computed) value of the property direction.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #direction}.
(Computed) value of direction.

Returns the (computed) value of the property mode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
(Computed) value of mode.

Returns the (computed) value of the property modifyDisplay.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.
(Computed) value of modifyDisplay.

Returns the (computed) value of the property xAmount.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #xAmount}.
(Computed) value of xAmount.

Returns the (computed) value of the property yAmount.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #yAmount}.
(Computed) value of yAmount.
Initial value for property direction.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property direction with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #direction}.
the default value
Initial value for property mode.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property mode with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
the default value
Initial value for property modifyDisplay.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property modifyDisplay with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.
the default value
Initial value for property xAmount.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property xAmount with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #xAmount}.
the default value
Initial value for property yAmount.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property yAmount with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #yAmount}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property modifyDisplay equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.
Whether the property equals true.

Resets the user value of the property direction.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #direction}.

Resets the user value of the property mode.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.

Resets the user value of the property modifyDisplay.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.

Resets the user value of the property xAmount.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #xAmount}.

Resets the user value of the property yAmount.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #yAmount}.
New value for property direction.

Sets the user value of the property direction.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #direction}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property mode.

Sets the user value of the property mode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #mode}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property modifyDisplay.

Sets the user value of the property modifyDisplay.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property xAmount.

Sets the user value of the property xAmount.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #xAmount}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property yAmount.

Sets the user value of the property yAmount.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #yAmount}.
The unmodified incoming value.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property modifyDisplay.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #modifyDisplay}.
the new value
Direction in which the element should drop out.
String indicating if element should drop in or out
Flag indicating if the CSS attribute “display” should be modified by effect
Amount of pixel the element should move horizontally while fading out.
Amount of pixel the element should move vertically while fading out.
